Analysis.description:
An analysis that is designed to meet a requirement of the reporting event. Each analysis is defined as a set of specifications, including:
* The analysis variable that is the subject of the analysis.
* The analysis method (set of statistical operations) that is performed for the analysis variable.
* The analysis set (subject population) for which the analysis is performed.
* The subset of data records on which the analysis is performed (optional).
* One or more factors by which either subjects or data records are grouped for analysis (optional).

analysisSetId.description: The identifier of the referenced analysis set.

categoryIds.description: References to any implementer-defined categories that apply to the analysis.

dataSubsetId.description: The identifier of the referenced data subset.

description.description: A textual description of the instance of the class.

id.description: The assigned identifying value for the instance of the class.

methodId.description: A reference to the set of one or more statistical operations performed for the analysis.

name.description: The name for the instance of the class.

orderedGroupings.description: An ordered list of grouping factors used in the analysis.

programmingCode.description: Programming statements and/or a reference to the program used to perform the specific analysis.

purpose.description: The purpose of the analysis within the body of evidence (e.g., section in the clinical study report).

reason.description: The rationale for performing this analysis. It indicates when the analysis was planned.

referencedAnalysisOperations.description: Indications of which analysis contains the results for each referenced operation.

Analysis.title: Analysis

AnalysisCategorization.description: A set of related implementer-defined categories that can be used to categorize analyses or outputs.

categories.description: Implementer-defined categories of analyses/outputs, each of which may include one or more sub-categorization.

id.description: The assigned identifying value for the instance of the class.

AnalysisCategorization.title: AnalysisCategorization

AnalysisCategory.description: An implementer-defined category of analyses/outputs, which may include one or more sub-categorization.

id.description: The assigned identifying value for the instance of the class.

subCategorizations.description: Sets of related implementer-defined sub-categories that can be used to categorize analyses or outputs.

AnalysisCategory.title: AnalysisCategory

AnalysisGroup.description: A subdivision of the subject population based on a defined factor (e.g., subjects whose treatment is Drug A, subjects whose gender is male).

id.description: The assigned identifying value for the instance of the class.

level.description: The level of the entry within a hierarchical structure.

order.description: The ordinal of the instance with respect to other instances.

AnalysisGroup.title: AnalysisGroup

AnalysisMethod.description: A set of one or more statistical operations.

codeTemplate.description: Template programming statements and/or a reference to the template program used to perform the specific analysis.

description.description: A textual description of the instance of the class.

id.description: The assigned identifying value for the instance of the class.

name.description: The name for the instance of the class.

operations.description: The calculations performed for the method. Each operation generates a statistical result.

AnalysisMethod.title: AnalysisMethod

AnalysisOutputCodeParameter.description: A parameter whose value is used in programming code for a specific analysis or output.

description.description: A textual description of the instance of the class.

name.description: The name for the instance of the class.

AnalysisOutputCodeParameter.title: AnalysisOutputCodeParameter

AnalysisOutputProgrammingCode.description: Programming statements and/or a reference to the program used to perform a specific analysis or create a specific output.

code.description: Programming statements used to perform the specific analysis.

context.description: The name and version of the computer language used for the actual programming statements provided.

parameters.description: Parameter values used to generate or execute the programming code.

AnalysisOutputProgrammingCode.title: AnalysisOutputProgrammingCode

AnalysisProgrammingCodeTemplate.description: Programming statements and/or a reference to a used as a template for creation of a program to perform method operations for a specific analysis.

code.description: Programming statements used to perform the specific analysis.

context.description: The name and version of the computer language used for the actual programming statements provided.

parameters.description: Parameters whose values will be used to generate or execute the programming code for a specific analysis.

AnalysisProgrammingCodeTemplate.title: AnalysisProgrammingCodeTemplate

AnalysisPurpose.description: The purpose of the analysis within the body of evidence (e.g., section in the clinical study report).

controlledTerm.description: One of the permissible values from the referenced enumeration.

AnalysisPurpose.title: AnalysisPurpose

AnalysisPurposeEnum.description: The purpose of the analysis within the body of evidence (e.g., section in the clinical study report).
AnalysisPurposeEnum.title: AnalysisPurposeEnum

AnalysisReason.description: The rationale for performing this analysis.

controlledTerm.description: One of the permissible values from the referenced enumeration.

AnalysisReasonEnum.description: The rationale for performing this analysis. It indicates when the analysis was planned.

AnalysisSet.description: A set of subjects whose data are to be included in the main analyses. This should be defined in the statistical section of the protocol. NOTE: There are a number of potential analysis sets, including, for example, the set based upon the intent-to-treat principle. [ICH E9]

id.description: The assigned identifying value for the instance of the class.

level.description: The level of the entry within a hierarchical structure.

order.description: The ordinal of the instance with respect to other instances.

AnalysisSet.title: AnalysisSet

CompoundGroupExpression.description: A compound expression consisting of either two or more identified group combined with the `AND` or `OR` logical operator, or a single identified group negated with the `NOT` logical operator.
CompoundGroupExpression.title: CompoundGroupExpression

CompoundSetExpression.description: A compound expression consisting of either two or more identified analysis sets combined with the `AND` or `OR` logical operator, or a single identified analysis set negated with the `NOT` logical operator.

CompoundSubsetExpression.description: A compound expression consisting of either two or more where clauses combined with the `AND` or `OR` logical operator, or a single where clause negated with the `NOT` logical operator.
CompoundSubsetExpression.title: CompoundSubsetExpression

level.description: The level of the entry within a hierarchical structure.

order.description: The ordinal of the instance with respect to other instances.

DataGroup.title: DataGroup

DataGroupingFactor.description: A factor used to subdivide data records in an analysis dataset for analysis.

dataDriven.description: Indicates whether the groups defined by the grouping are prespecified (false) or obtained from distinct data values of the groupingVariable (true).

groupingVariable.description: For groupings based on a single variable, a reference to the dataset variable upon which grouping is based.

groups.description: The pre-specified groups within the grouping.

id.description: The assigned identifying value for the instance of the class.

DataGroupingFactor.title: DataGroupingFactor

DataSubset.description: A subset of data identified by selection criteria for inclusion in the analysis.

id.description: The assigned identifying value for the instance of the class.

level.description: The level of the entry within a hierarchical structure.

order.description: The ordinal of the instance with respect to other instances.

DataSubset.title: DataSubset

DisplaySection.description: A part of a tabular display containing one or more pieces of informational text.
DisplaySection.title: DisplaySection

DisplaySubSection.description: An occurrence of a display section containing text.

id.description: The assigned identifying value for the instance of the class.

DisplaySubSection.title: DisplaySubSection

DocumentReference.description: A reference to an external document.

pageRefs.description: A list of references to specific parts of a document, which may be referenced as a list of one or more page numbers, a range of page numbers, or a list of named destinations in the document (e.g. bookmarks).

ExpressionLogicalOperatorEnum.description: A Boolean operator, a symbol or a function that denotes a logical operation (e.g., and, or, not).

Operation.description: A statistical operation that produces a single analysis result value as part of an analysis method.

id.description: The assigned identifying value for the instance of the class.

name.description: The name for the instance of the class.

Operation.title: Operation

OperationResult.description: The result of an analysis method operation performed on a subdivision of subjects or data records.

controlledTerm.description: One of the permissible values from the referenced enumeration.

level.description: The level of the entry within a hierarchical structure.

name.description: The name for the instance of the class.

order.description: The ordinal of the instance with respect to other instances.

ReportingEvent.description: A set of analyses and outputs created to meet a specific reporting requirement, such as a CSR or interim analysis.

analyses.description: The analyses defined for the reporting event.

analysisCategorizations.description: Sets of related implementer-defined categories that can be used to categorize analyses or outputs.

analysisGroupings.description: Characteristics used to subdivide the subject population (e.g., treatment, sex, age group).

analysisSets.description: The analysis sets (subject populations) defined for the reporting event.

dataGroupings.description: Characteristics used to subdivide data records in analysis datasets (e.g., visit, system organ class).

dataSubsets.description: Subsets of data identified by selection criteria for inclusion in analysis definitions.

id.description: The assigned identifying value for the instance of the class.

listOfPlannedAnalyses.description: A structured list of the analyses defined for the reporting event.

listOfPlannedOutputs.description: An optional structured list of the outputs defined for the reporting event.

methods.description: The defined methods used to analyze any analysis variable.

name.description: The name for the instance of the class.

outputs.description: The outputs defined for the reporting event.

terminologyExtensions.description: Any sponsor-defined extensions to extensible terminology.

ReportingEvent.title: ReportingEvent

ResultGroup.description: For the specified grouping factor, an indication of the specific group of subjects or data records associated with the analysis result.

groupId.description: The identifier of a referenced predefined group within a grouping.

groupValue.description: The data value used as a group within a data-driven grouping.

groupingId.description: The identifier of the referenced subject or data grouping factor.

submissionValue.description: The specific value expected for submissions.

SubjectGroupingFactor.description: A factor used to subdivide the subject population for comparative analysis (e.g., treatment, sex, race, age).

dataDriven.description: Indicates whether the groups defined by the grouping are prespecified (false) or obtained from distinct data values of the groupingVariable (true).

groupingVariable.description: For groupings based on a single variable, a reference to the dataset variable upon which grouping is based.

groups.description: The pre-specified groups within the grouping.

id.description: The assigned identifying value for the instance of the class.

TemplateCodeParameter.description: A replacement parameter whose value is substituted in template programming code to create statements required for a specific analysis.

description.description: A textual description of the instance of the class.

name.description: The name for the instance of the class.

value.description: The value to be used for the parameter when the method is used in an analysis. Multiple values may be specified to indicate a choice.

valueSource.description: A reference to the prespecified source of the value for the parameter.

TerminologyExtension.description: An extensible set of controlled terminology that has been extended with at least one sponsor-defined term.
